snippet: The Knicks won their first playoff game in 11 years and trimmed the Heat’s series lead to 3-1 as Carmelo Anthony and Amar’e Stoudemire combined for 61 points.
abstract: New York Knicks defeat Miami Heat, 89-87, to win their first playoff game in 11 years and stave off elimination; Miami leads first-round series, 3-1; Knicks forward Carmelo Anthony gives a star performance, driving the Knicks to victory with 41 points. Photos, Chart (M)d
lead_paragraph: The far right side of the dry-erase board in the Knicks' home locker room is reserved for scheduling, a hand-scrawled, quick-reference guide to workouts, rehabilitation sessions and travel plans. Their Tuesday itinerary -- spelled out in thick, black ink and all capital letters -- read like redemption: ''11:00 a.m. -- Film.''

headline.main: Stopping a Sweep, and a Streak
